required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Radiological Predictors of Failure of Endoscopic Therapy or Need For Multiple Endoscopic Procedures in Patients With Walled Off Pancreatic Necrosis

collaborator.agency: Saint Luke's Hospital University of Missouri-Kansas City

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective chart review study examining 1) demographic data such as age, sex, etiology of pancreatitis 2) clinical data including radiological characteristics of walled off pancreatic necrosis, walled off necrosis related admissions and readmission following endoscopic drainage, surgical or percutaneous procedures performed for the management of walled off pancreatic necrosis, and clinical outcomes following treatment of WON (including hospital readmissions, WON resolution, procedure complications, WON related death) 3) endoscopy data including indication for initial endoscopic drainage and subsequent endoscopic procedures performed for management of walled off necrosis (including additional EGD's, endoscopic drainage procedures, and/or necrosectomy)

primary_outcome.measure: Identify WON imaging characteristics on cat-scan
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 260 days
primary_outcome.description: Characteristics on cat-scan that are predictive of requiring multiple endoscopic procedures, percutaneous drainage, and/or surgical intervention for management of walled off pancreatic necrosis

primary_outcome.measure: Endoscopic course (total number and type of endoscopic treatments required for resolution of walled off necrosis, occurrence of treatment related complications)
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 260 days
primary_outcome.description: Imaging classification method to efficiently report these imaging characteristics

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical course (number of hospital readmissions during treatment, rates of walled off necrosis resolution, rates of walled off necrosis related death)
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 260 days
primary_outcome.description: Characteristics to develop a predictive model that will help to identify patients at high risk for requiring multiple endoscopic procedures, percutaneous drainage, and/or surgical intervention for management of walled off pancreatic necrosis.

arm_group.description: Group one includes patients who underwent less than median number necrosectomies

arm_group.arm_group_label: At least the median number of necrosectomies
arm_group.description: Group two includes patients who underwent at least the median number of necrosectomies

intervention.intervention_name: endoscopic drainage of walled off pancreatic necrosis
intervention.description: transmural drainage and mechanical debridement of solid debris (necrosectomy)
intervention.arm_group_label: At least the median number of necrosectomies

study_pop.textblock: Patients with organized collections that contain both solid and liquid debris and arise from necrotizing pancreatitis, referred to as walled off pancreatic necrosis (WON)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients over 18 years of age who underwent endoscopic drainage of walled off pancreatic necrosis
- Patients who did not require further intervention (either surgical, percutaneous, or endoscopic) following endoscopic drainage
- Patients who required further intervention for walled off pancreatic necrosis (either surgical, percutaneous, or endoscopic) following endoscopic drainage.
- Patients who underwent percutaneous or surgical interventions prior to endoscopic drainage
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pancreatic pseudocysts without any solid debris
- Under 18 years of age at the time of endoscopic drainage

facility.name: Washington University School of Medicine in St Louis
